title: Supplemental stanza to Maoz Tsur for Ḥanukkah 2024, by Eitan Meshullam Chai
author: Eitan Meshullam Chai Runyan

coauthors.name: Eitan Meshullam Chai Runyan
coauthors.bio: I am an observant Jewish transgender man. My transgender identity is deeply tied to my Jewish identity, and I attempt to represent this intersection in my artwork and religious expression.

excerpt: An additional stanza to the popular Ḥanukkah song, Maoz Tsur, for the second Ḥanukkah after the massacres on 7 October 2023. . . .
content:
Source (Hebrew) Translation (English)
הייתה במועד שמחת תורה
פרצו בגבול ועשו שחיטה
שכנינו צחקו ובגדנו
כשחטפו את אחינו
כבר עברה שנה ועוד
בלי נוח ובלי שלום
תגן את עמך, תחזיר שבוייך
שיהיה לנו שוב מועד שמחה
It happened on the festival of Simchat Torah
They broke through the border and committed a massacre
Our neighbours laughed and betrayed us
When they kidnapped our brethren
A year already passed and more
Without rest and without peace
Protect Your nation, return Your captives
So that we’ll once more have a festival of joy
